skill.description:
Use when deploying Next.js applications to Vercel.
Triggers for: vercel.json configuration, build optimization, environment variable setup,
custom domain configuration, API proxy setup, or deployment troubleshooting.
NOT for: backend-only deployments, non-Vercel hosting, or local development setup.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with 144 false positive static findings. Scanner confused documentation examples with executable code. No network calls, no command execution, no file writes. The verify.py script only reads and validates SKILL.md format using regex parsing.

content.value_statement: Deploy Next.js applications to Vercel with optimized build settings, environment variables, and custom domain configuration. Expert guidance for production-ready deployments.
actual_capabilities: Configure vercel.json with build commands, regions, and output directories
Set up environment variables for production and preview deployments
Configure custom domains with DNS settings and HTTPS certificates
Create API proxy rewrites and redirects for backend integration
Optimize build settings for performance and caching
Set up custom error pages and security headers
limitations: Does not execute deployments (requires Vercel CLI or Git integration)
Does not manage non-Vercel hosting platforms
Does not configure local development environments
Does not handle backend-only deployments without frontend

output_examples.input: Help me deploy my Next.js app to Vercel for the first time
output: Create vercel.json with build command and output directory
Configure environment variables in Vercel Dashboard

output_examples.input: How do I configure custom error pages on Vercel
Set up API proxy for my backend API
output: Add rewrites to vercel.json pointing to your API URL
Use Next.js rewrites in next.config.js as alternative
Set up CORS headers for cross-origin requests
Test proxy locally before production deployment

best_practices: Always use NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix only for variables that need client access
Test builds locally with npm run build before deploying to Vercel
Use vercel.json regions to deploy closest to your users
Configure custom error pages before going live
anti_patterns: Never commit .env.local files to version control
Avoid using wildcard domains without proper DNS configuration
Do not expose sensitive API keys with NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix
Never hardcode API URLs; use environment variables instead

faq.question: Does this skill deploy my application?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides configuration guidance. Run vercel --prod or use Vercel Git integration to actually deploy.

faq.question: What Next.js versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Next.js 13+ with App Router. Works with Pages Router but some features are optimized for App Router.

faq.question: How do I deploy from CI/CD?
faq.answer: Use vercel --token=$VERCEL_TOKEN --yes in your pipeline. Get VERCEL_TOKEN from Vercel Dashboard.

faq.question: Is my code safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill. It only reads your configuration files to provide guidance.

faq.question: Why is my build failing on Vercel?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing dependencies, incorrect build command, environment variables not set, or platform-specific code.

faq.question: How is this different from Vercel CLI?
faq.answer: This skill provides configuration guidance and troubleshooting. Vercel CLI is the actual tool that performs deployments.
